content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```E-Jay Mathematics Researcher About Myself: I have mathematical knowledge up to the post-graduate level.

These are my current research areas or areas of study:
(1) coding: mainly Python and full-stack web development
(2) machine learning and artificial intelligence```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Be precise and comprehensive in your analysis. Tell it like it is; don't sugar-coat responses. Take a forward-thinking view.```

user_context_message_data.about_user_message:
E-Jay Mathematics Researcher About Myself: I have mathematical knowledge up to the post-graduate level.

These are my current research areas or areas of study:
(1) coding: mainly Python and full-stack web development
(2) machine learning and artificial intelligence
user_context_message_data.about_model_message: Be precise and comprehensive in your analysis. Tell it like it is; don't sugar-coat responses. Take a forward-thinking view.

parts: This is a tenancy agreement which I intend to sign with my landlord, to renew the current lease of my tuition center. Please examine the agreement carefully, highlight important points I should note, and examine for adherence to both Singapore law as well as to commercial rental best practices in the Singapore context

thoughts.content: Pulling in details to give the best answer

parts: Make sure to include citeturn0file0 in your response to cite this file.

additions and deletions that were made on the standard Tenancy Agreement form that had been done with the consent and 
agreement of both parties prior to the signing of the agreement. 
Landlord Tenant
Initials

NRIC : S0179461B 
Address : 203 HOUGANG STREET 21 #01-83 SINGAPORE 530203 
(hereinafter called “the Landlord” which expression shall where the context so admits include the person entitled for the time being 
to the reversion immediately expectant on the term hereby created) of the one part. 
AND 
Name : NG E-JAY (HUANG YIJIE) 
NRIC : S7724753Z 
Address : 203 HOUGANG STREET 21 #01-83 SINGAPORE 530203 
 (hereinafter called “the Tenant” which expression shall where the context so admits include the Tenant’s successors and assigns) 
of the other part. 
WHEREBY IT IS AGREED as follows: 
1. The Landlord agrees to let and the Tenant agrees to take all that property with an approximate area of 280 sq. ft. known as 
203 HOUGANG STREET 21 #01-83 SINGAPORE 530203 (right side)(hereinafter called “the said premises”) together with 
the furniture, fixtures and fittings therein belonging to the Landlord as specified in the Schedule annexed hereto (hereinafter 
called “the furniture”) TO HOLD unto the Tenant from the 1
st JUNE 2025 TO 31ST MAY 2027 for a fixed term of TWENTYFOUR (24) months, at the monthly rental in the sum of Singapore Dollars FIVE THOUSAND ONLY ($5,000.00) payable 
monthly in advance without deduction whatsoever on the 1ST day of each calendar month to which is payable monthly in 
advance without deduction whatsoever on the 1ST day of each calendar month. 
2. The Tenant hereby agrees with the Landlord as follows: 
(a) (a) To pay the said rent and hiring charges at the times and in the manner aforesaid without any 
deduction whatsoever. Monthly rental to be deposited before or on the 1st of every month to 
DBS ACCOUNT 023 000 299 0 
(b) To pay a deposit of SINGAPORE DOLLARS TEN THOUSAND ONLY (S$ 10,000.00) being 
equivalent to 2 months’ rent upon the signing of this Agreement (the receipt whereof the 
Landlord hereby acknowledges) as security deposit against the breach of any term or condition 
of this Agreement, such deposit is to be refunded within fourteen (14) days (free of interest) 
at any expiry or lawful termination of this tenancy provided the Tenant shall have duly 
performed and observed the stipulated terms and conditions therein, otherwise the same or 
part owing by the Tenant without prejudice to the right of the Landlord to recover all monies 
which may become due or payable by the Tenant under this Agreement. 
(c) To pay all charges due in respect of any telephones or other equipment installed at the said 
premises, including any tax payable thereon. 
(d) To pay all charges for the supply of water, electricity, gas and any water borne sewerage 
system, any such installations fitted or used at the said premises, including any tax payable 
thereon. 
(e) `To keep the interior of the said premises including the sanitary and water apparatus, furniture, 
doors and windows thereof in good and tenantable repair and condition throughout this tenancy 
(fair wear and tear and damage by any act beyond the control of the Tenant excepted).
RENTAL PAYMENT 
SECURITY DEPOSIT 
PAYMENT OF 
OUTGOINGS 
INTERIOR 
MAINTENANCE

Landlord Tenant
Initials
(f) (i) To permit the Landlord and its agents, surveyors and workmen with all necessary 
appliances to enter upon the said premises at all reasonable times by prior appointment 
for the purpose whether of viewing the condition thereof or of doing such works and 
things as may be required for any repairs, alterations or improvements whether of the 
said premises or of any parts of any building to which the said premises may form a part 
of or adjoin. 
(ii) During the two (2) months immediately preceding the expiration of the tenancy herein to 
permit the Landlord or its representatives at all reasonable times and by prior appointment 
to bring interested parties to view and the said premises for the purpose of letting the 
same. 
(iii) During the currency of this tenancy, to allow the Landlord or its representatives at all 
reasonable times and by prior appointment to bring any interested parties to view the said 
premises in the event of a prospective sale thereof. 
(g) To be responsible for all minor repairs and routine maintenance of the premises not exceeding 
S$200.00 per job/repair, per item throughout the term of the said lease. In the event any repair 
and/or maintenance exceeds S$200.00 per job/repair, per item, then the initial S$200.00 shall 
be borne by the Tenant and any excess to be borne by the Landlord. This clause will only take 
effect after 30 days upon commencement of lease. During the first 30 days of the lease, there 
will be a warranty against all repair or replacement of the fixtures. fittings provided by the 
Landlord. 
(h) At all times during the term hereby created to comply with all such requirements as may be 
imposed upon the Tenant by Management Corporation requirements and or any statute 
legislation now or hereafter in force and any orders, rules, regulations, requirements and 
notices thereunder. 
(i) To yield up the said premises at the expiration or sooner determination of this tenancy in such 
good and tenantable repair and condition (fair wear and tear excepted) as shall be in 
accordance with the conditions, covenants and stipulations herein contained and with all locks/ 
keys and the furniture. 
(j) To take up a service contract with a competent air-conditioner maintenance contractor once 
every 3 months. The Landlord shall pay for all necessary repairs and/or replacement of the airconditioning units or parts. However, the Landlord shall not be responsible for repairs and/or 
replacement of the air-conditioning units or parts if the Tenants failed to show proof of regular 
maintenance contract as stipulated. Under such circumstances, the Tenant shall be fully 
responsible for the repair and/or replacement of the air-conditioning unit or parts. Tenant is 
responsible for any topping up of gas and chemical cleaning. 
(j) Not to make or permit to be made any structural alterations to the said premises. 
(k) Not to use the said premises or any part thereof other than a Tuition Centre in connection 
with and for the purpose of the Tenant’s business and to obtain licences and permits at the 
Tenant’s expense from the relevant authorities where necessary (*delete whichever is not 
appropriate). 
(l) Not to exceed the maximum electricity load and not to load or permit to be loaded on any part 
of the floors of the said premises weights exceeding those specified by the Landlord, 
Management Corporation or other bodies (where applicable). 
(m) Not to assign sublet or part with the possession of the said premises or any part thereof without 
the written consent of the Landlord whose consent shall not be unreasonably withheld in the 
case of a respectable and responsible tenant. This prohibition shall not apply to the occupation 
of the said premises or any part thereof by any person or persons employed or engaged by 
the Tenant or members of the Tenant’s family where applicable. 
(n) Not to keep or permit to be kept on the said premises or any part thereof any materials of a 
dangerous or explosive nature or the keeping of which may contravene any statute or 
subsidiary legislation.

Landlord Tenant
Initials
(o) Not to do or permit to be done anything whereby the policy or policies of insurance on the said 
premises against damage by fire may become void or voidable or whereby the premium 
thereon may be increased. 
(p) Not to use the demised premises or any part thereof for any unlawful or immoral purposes and 
not to do or permit or suffer to be done upon the demised premises any act or thing which may 
become a nuisance to or annoyance to or give cause for reasonable complaints from the 
occupants of other parts of the building or of adjoining or adjacent properties. 
(q) To be responsible for and to indemnify the Landlord from and against all claims and demands 
and against damage occasioned to the demised premises or any adjacent or neighboring 
premises or injury caused to any person by any act default or negligence of the Tenant or the 
servants, agents, licensees or invitees of the Tenant. 
(r) Not to obstruct or cause or suffer to be obstructed the hall lobby staircases landings and 
passages leading to the demised premises. 
(s) To ensure that the Tenant’s employees, servants, agents or visitors do not obstruct the areas 
designated as loading/unloading areas and at all times comply with the directions of the 
Landlord’s staff or agents exercising due control of such areas. 
(t) To keep the said premises free of pests, insects, rodents, birds and animals and if required by 
the Landlord to employ from time to time or periodically, a pest-exterminating contractor 
approved by the Landlord to inspect and ensure that the said premises free of pests. 
(u) The cleanliness and daily maintenance of the shared toilet is the responsibilities of the two 
ground floor unit tenant. 
(v) To keep the said premises well and sufficiently lighted throughout the hours of business of the 
said premises and/or Building. 
(w) To maintain, keep clean and free of chokage any drains, plumbing facilities or piping system 
serving the said premises. 
(x) Where the permitted occupants are non-Singaporeans to carry out due diligence checks to 
ensure that at all times during the currency of this Agreement that the Tenant and/or permitted 
occupants comply with all the rules and regulations relating to the Immigration Act and the 
Employment of Foreign Workers Act (if applicable) and any other Act of Parliament, 
Regulations or any rules or orders thereunder which relates to foreign residents and workers. 
 - To provide the Landlord upon request, for physical inspection, all immigration and 
employment documents, including but not limited to the passports of all non-local occupants, 
the employment pass and/or work permits, proof of employment and to provide the Landlord 
with certified true copies of such documents. 
- To authorise, permit and co-operate with the Landlord to make such enquiries with 
relevant government departments and/or employers to verify the same. 
- To accept responsibility including criminal prosecution and the consequences thereof and 
to hold the Landlord harmless and indemnify the Landlord to the fullest extent allowed by 
the laws of the Republic of Singapore should any person who is a prohibited immigrant be 
found at the said premises. 
 
(y) Save for the Tenants’ business name sign, not to paint or affix any other signs, signboards, 
notices, flagstaff, placard or poster of any kind or other devices on the exterior walls, windows 
and doors thereof or in any part of the Building except such as shall be approved in writing by 
the Landlord or the Management. 
(z) To apply for and obtain all necessary permits/licence etc from the relevant authorities for the 
use of the said premises for their trade.

(a) To pay all rates, taxes, maintenance charges and any surcharges thereon, assessments and

charged or imposed on the said premises including any surcharges payable thereon. 
(b) To insure the said premises against loss or damage by fire and to pay all premium thereon. 
(c) To be responsible for the repair and replacement of parts in respect of the air-conditioning 
units installed at the said premises save where the same are caused by any act, default,

(d) To maintain the structural condition of the said premises including sanitary pipes and electrical 
wiring and to keep the roof of the said premises in good and tenantable repair and condition. 
(e) That the Tenant paying the rent hereby reserved, observing and performing the several 
conditions, covenants and stipulations on the Tenant’s part herein contained shall peaceably 
hold and enjoy the said premises during this tenancy without any interruption by the Landlord 
or any person rightfully claiming under or in trust for the Landlord. 
PAYMENT OF TAXES 
INSURANCE

STRUCTURAL 
MAINTENANCE

/ ENJOYMENT 
4. Provided always and it is expressly agreed as follows: 
(a) If the rent hereby reserved or any part thereof shall be unpaid for seven (7) days after 
becoming payable (whether formally demanded or not) or if the Tenant shall at anytime fail or 
neglect to perform or observe any of the obligations, stipulations and agreements herein 
contained on his part to be performed or observed or if the Tenant or any other person in 
whom for the time being the tenancy be vested shall become bankrupt or enter into 
composition with the Tenant’s creditors or suffer any distress or execution to be levied on the 
Tenant’s goods or if the Tenant being a company shall go into liquidation whether voluntary 
(save for the purpose of amalgamation or reconstruction) or compulsory then and in any of 
the said cases it shall be lawful for the Landlord at any time thereafter to re-enter upon the 
premises or any part thereof and thereupon this tenancy shall absolutely terminate but 
without prejudice to the right of action of the Landlord in respect of any antecedent breach of 
this Agreement by the Tenant. The Landlord has the rights after seven (7) days to evict the 
tenants, re-enter and take possession of the premise, including all the equipment and item. 
(b) In the event the rent remaining unpaid seven (7) days after becoming payable (whether 
formally demanded or not), it shall be lawful for the Landlord to claim interest at ten percent 
(10%) calculated on monthly basis on the amount unpaid calculated from after the date due to 
the date of actual payment. 
(c) The Landlord shall not be liable to the Tenant or the Tenant’s servants or agents or other 
persons in the said premises or persons calling upon the Tenant for any accidents happening, 
injury suffered, damage to or loss of any chattel property sustained on the said premises. 
(d) In case the said premises or any part thereof shall at any time during this tenancy be destroyed 
or damaged by fire lightning riot explosion or any other cause beyond the control of the parties 
hereto so as to be unfit for occupation and use, then and in every such case (unless the 
insurance money shall be wholly or partially irrecoverable by reason solely or in part of any 
act, default, neglect or omission of the Tenant or any of their servants agents occupiers guests 
or visitors), the rent hereby reserved or a just and fair proportion thereof according to the nature 
and extent of the destruction or damage sustained shall be suspended and cease to be payable 
in respect of any period while the said premises shall continue to be unfit for occupation and 
use by reason of such destruction or damage. 
(e) In case the said premises shall be destroyed or damaged as aforesaid, either party shall be at 
liberty by notice in writing to the other determine this tenancy, and upon such notice being 
given, this tenancy or the balance thereof shall absolutely cease and determine and the deposit 
paid hereunder together with a reasonable proportion of such advance rent as has been paid 
hereunder, where applicable, shall be refunded to the Tenant forthwith but without prejudice to 
any right of action of either party in respect of any antecedent breach of this Agreement by the 
other. 
(f) If the Tenant is in breach of any clause of this agreement, leading to an early termination of 
the tenancy, then the Tenant shall in any event reimburse the Landlord on a pro rata basis the 
commission the Landlord has paid to PROPNEX REALTY PTE LTD (hereinafter called ‘the 
DEFAULT OF 
TENANT 
RENT IN ARREARS 
LIMITED LIABILITY 
OF LANDLORD

SUSPENSION OF 
RENT

Agency’ ) for the remaining unfulfilled term, without prejudice to any other rights of the Landlord 
to claim against the Tenant for any other breaches of this agreement. 
(g) It is expressly understood by the Landlord that the commission paid to the as the brokerage 
fee in this transaction has been fully earned for services rendered and there the Landlord shall 
have no claim against the Agency for a refund of the commission should the Tenant 
prematurely terminate the tenancy herein or for any other reasons. 
(h) The Landlord shall on the written request of the Tenant made not less than two (2) months 
before the date of expiry of this tenancy, and if there shall not at the time of such request be 
any existing breach or any non-observance of any of the conditions, covenants or stipulations 
on the part of the Tenant herein contained, at the expense of the Tenant, grant to the Tenant 
a tenancy of the said premises for a further term of TWO (02) years from the date of expiry of 
this tenancy at a rent to be agreed based on the prevailing market rent but otherwise containing 
the like conditions, covenants and stipulations as are herein contained with the exception of 
this option for renewal. In the event that the Landlord should grant the Tenant an extension of 
the said term herein then the Landlord and the Tenant shall pay the agency renewal 
commission of half month and GST for every one (1) year or less period of extension of lease. 
(i) Any notice served under or in any way in connection with this Agreement shall be sufficiently 
served on the Tenant if left at the said premises or delivered to the Tenant personally or sent 
to the Tenant at the said premises by registered post and shall be sufficiently served on the 
Landlord if delivered to the Landlord personally or sent to the abovementioned address by 
registered post. Any notice sent by registered post shall deemed to be given at the time when 
in due course of post it would be delivered at the address to which it is sent. 
(j) Notwithstanding anything herein contained the said term may at any time after the expiration 
of the first SIX (06) months of the said term be determined on documentary evidence that the 
property’s Option to Purchase has been exercised, the Landlord is able to terminate the lease 
giving the Tenant FIVE (5) calendar months’ notice. Deposit to be fully refunded and no claim 
is to be made against each party. 
(k) The waiver by either party of a breach of default of any of the provisions in this Agreement 
shall not be construed as a waiver of any succeeding breach of the same or other provisions 
nor any delay or omission on the part of either party to exercise or avail itself of any right that 
it has or may have herein, operates as a waiver of any breach or default of the other party. 
(l) The stamp duty for stamping this Agreement in duplicate and any legal cost shall be borne by 
the Tenant and shall be paid on the date of signing of this Agreement. 
(m) This Agreement shall be subject to the laws of the Republic of Singapore.

thoughts.content: The user has provided a tenancy agreement to review, and I'll need to look for key aspects like clauses on renewal, termination, repairs, and indemnity. I'm also making sure it's consistent with Singapore law, including any potential requirements for tuition centers like URA approval, MOE registration, and BCA compliance. I'll check statutory regulations like fire safety and licensing. If it's a HDB shophouse, it might still be considered commercial property under Singapore's Land Titles Act. It's important to highlight the details that require attention.

The tenancy agreement has some concerning clauses. First, the landlord’s right to evict after only 7 days of arrears seems extreme and may violate legal protections. Plus, the interest charge for late rent is a high 10% per month, which might be unenforceable under the Moneylenders Act. The option to renew lacks clarity, potentially risking hikes in rent. We need to negotiate terms like compensation for termination due to property sale or clarify the subletting restrictions and insurance responsibilities. Plus, ensuring the property meets regulatory requirements is key.

parts:
Below is a clause‑by‑clause review of the proposed lease, framed around three lenses: * **Key commercial & operational points you should note** * **Compliance with Singapore statutes / regulatory practice** * **Alignment with market “best‑practice” for small‑business commercial leases** All clause numbers refer to the PDF you provided. citeturn0file0 --- ### 1  Core commercial terms | Item | What the draft says | Comments & risks | |------|--------------------|------------------| | **Premises & size** | 203 Hougang St 21 #01‑83, 280 sq ft | Check URA’s Approved Use; tuition falls under “Commercial – Education/Training Centre”. If the current use class is “Shop”, the landlord (not you) must file a free *Change of Use* application before 1 June 2025. | | **Term** | 1 Jun 2025 – 31 May 2027 (24 mths) | Standard two‑year cycle. No rent‑review/escalation clause, so rent is flat at S$5 000 pm. | | **Security deposit** | S$10 000 (2 months) refundable “within 14 days” of lease expiry | 14 days is acceptable; many contracts use 30 days. You may ask for the refund to occur **after joint inspection & hand‑back** to avoid unilateral deductions. | | **Rent due** | 1st of each month; late interest **10 % per month** after 7 days in arrears | 10 % *per month* (~214 % p.a.) is arguably an unenforceable penalty. Market norm is 2 % – 3 % **per annum** above DBS prime or SORA. Seek to amend. | | **Minor repairs** | Tenant bears first S$200 per job | Typical, but make sure it is **per defect**, not aggregated per visit. | | **Air‑con servicing** | Quarterly contract at tenant’s cost; landlord pays parts unless no proof of servicing | Reasonable; keep service invoices. | | **Early landlord break** | After first 6 mths, landlord may terminate with **5 mths’ notice** if an Option to Purchase is exercised (sale clause 4(j)) | High business‑continuity risk. Negotiate either (a) strike the clause, or (b) require compensation (e.g. full refund of deposit **plus** 3‑6 months’ gross rent) if activated. | | **Renewal option** | 2‑year renewal at “market rent”; tenant must request ≥ 2 mths before expiry 4(h) | Add a **valuation mechanism** (e.g. average of two licensed valuers if parties disagree) or a fixed percentage cap to limit rent shock. | | **Commission claw‑back** | If you break the lease, you must reimburse landlord’s PropNex commission pro‑rated 4(f) | Understand total commission quantum first; negotiate a cap. | --- ### 2  Legal & regulatory compliance checklist | Topic | Draft status | Singapore‑law note / best practice | |-------|-------------|------------------------------------| | **Access / re‑entry** | Landlord may “re‑enter & evict” after 7 days’ arrears, “including all equipment” 4(a) | *Self‑help eviction* contravenes the Distress Act and common‑law rules on peaceable re‑entry. Insist the clause say “**subject to an Order of Court**”. | | **Interest / penalty** | 10 % per month interest 4(b) | Could be struck down as a penalty; align with Civil Law (Interest on Judgment Debts) Act rates or Prime + 3 %. | | **Public liability insurance** | Tenant must not void fire insurance 2(o); no explicit public‑liability requirement | Most malls require at least **S$1 m public‑liability cover** naming landlord as additional insured. Add this to clarify risk allocation. | | **Change‑of‑use & tuition licensing** | Clause 2(k) says you will “obtain licences and permits” | In practice:
• URA change‑of‑use (free, online)
• Fire Safety Certificate (FSSD) for an “Educational Use” space
• MOE registration if >10 students per class or marketing as “tuition centre”
• HDB approval if unit is an HDB shophouse (the address suggests it is). Ask landlord to warrant these are in place or will be secured at their cost. | | **Third‑party liability / indemnity** | Broad indemnity to landlord 2(q) | Keep, but limit to *losses arising from tenant’s negligence*. Remove any wording that makes you liable for landlord’s own negligence. | | **Reinstatement** | Yield up “good & tenantable repair… with furniture” 2(i) | Attach a **Schedule of Condition** (photos) to avoid disputes about original state. | | **Stamp‑duty & legal fees** | All borne by tenant 4(l) | Normal in Singapore. Remember to e‑stamp within **14 days** of execution to avoid IRAS penalties. | | **Personal Data** | Agreement silent | If you collect student data, you are a *data controller* under PDPA. Not strictly a lease matter, but include PDPA clause in your operations. | --- ### 3  Market‑practice observations & negotiation pointers 1. **Late‑payment regime** – Replace “10 % per month” with “3 % p.a. above DBS Prime, calculated daily”. 2. **Landlord sale termination** – Either delete, or require a **six‑month rent‑free period** as compensation, or the landlord to secure equivalent premises within 1 km at same rent. 3. **Quiet enjoyment** – Clause 3(e) is good but add: “Landlord warrants it has HDB/URA consent to lease for tuition use.” 4. **Force majeure / pandemic closure** – Not covered. Consider adding a *rent‑abatement* clause tied to mandatory government closure (e.g. MOH or MOE directive). 5. **Renewal formula** – Propose “prevailing rent **but capped at +8 % over current rent** or as determined by an independent valuer, whichever lower”. 6. **Fire‑safety & fit‑out** – Insert landlord approval timeline (e.g. *“shall not unreasonably withhold consent and shall respond within 14 days”*) so fit‑out works stay on schedule. 7. **Deposit refund mechanics** – Clarify that refund is **within 14 days of joint inspection** rather than expiry per se. 8. **Utilities caps** – If utility bills are unpredictable, negotiate a sub‑meter or agree a load cap so you are not billed for neighbours’ consumption. 9. **Commission claw‑back** – Cap reimbursement to **1 month’s rent** maximum. 10. **Dispute resolution** – No mediation / arbitration clause. Consider inserting *Singapore Mediation Centre* as first step to avoid costly litigation. --- ### 4  Action checklist before you sign | Step | Deadline | Responsible | |------|----------|-------------| | Confirm URA “Education/Training Centre” approval & HDB landlord consent | Before 1 Jun 2025 | Landlord (obtain letter) | | Negotiate late‑interest, sale termination & self‑help eviction language | This week | You / agent | | Prepare Schedule of Condition photos | Before key collection | You | | Arrange **public‑liability insurance** (recommend ≥ S$1 m) | Before opening | You | | Engage air‑con contractor & keep quarterly invoices | Ongoing | You | | File e‑stamp (IRAS) | Within 14 days of signing | You | | Register / update MOE Private School status (if >10 students/class) | Before classes start | You | --- ## Bottom line The template is broadly standard, but three clauses need immediate attention: 1. **Exorbitant 10 % per month late‑interest and automatic 7‑day eviction** – renegotiate to statutory norms and court‑supervised re‑entry. 2. **Landlord’s 5‑month sale termination right** – either remove or secure fair compensation. 3. **Lack of explicit approvals & insurance warranties** – get landlord warranties and align insurance obligations. Resolve these points, append a detailed Schedule of Condition, and the lease should be commercially and legally sound for a tuition‑centre operation. citeturn0file0
